duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide primary desktop support for Windows Operating System, Mobile Device Management Infrastructure, Video Conferencing systems, and IT-to-IT support for all of Chevron’s Workforce Enablement product.
Ensure consistent processes, procedures, and technologies are utilized across the Chevron enterprise environment.
Understand and follow direction provided by the team leads and managers of different Chevron products and towers.
Document recurring issues in the Chevron Knowledge Base and in detail case status and tasks/work completed with end users in the Chevron ITSM system.
Provide white glove VC technical support for C-suite and high-level management and high-profile events.
Follow Chevron required safety protocols and complete regular training on safety and compliance.
Lead through influence and partner with geographically dispersed colleagues; build alignment using appropriate methods.
Foster an inclusive, collaborative style to ensure results are obtained and supported. Liaise with cross-functional teams leading lean sigma process improvement initiatives.
Analyze given situations, develop mental models of complex problems, and identify and recommend approaches to solving them.
Develop and communicate a compelling business case for the use of IT through a strong understanding of Chevron business drivers and opportunities.
Demonstrate the ability to see the bigger picture, denote how processes/tools will impact other processes/tools. Communicate with transparency the impact and risks with mitigation.
Lead and conduct business requirements, process flows, and technical specifications for the implementation of IT solutions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in IT or Computer Science preferred (Master's preferred)
